context_bundle.summary: Event-Driven Architecture (EDA): Components communicate via events (state changes). Patterns: Event Sourcing (store events, not state), CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation), Event Bus (Kafka, EventBridge), Pub/Sub. Benefits: loose coupling, scalability, async processing. Challenges: eventual consistency, event ordering, debugging. Use cases: microservices communication, audit logs, real-time analytics, IoT. Tools: Kafka (event streaming), EventBridge (AWS), Azure Event Grid.

onboarding.quick_start: Event-Driven: Services publish events (UserRegistered, OrderPlaced), other services subscribe and react. Event Sourcing: store events (AccountCredited $100), rebuild state by replaying. CQRS: separate write (commands) and read (queries) models, optimize each. Event Bus: Kafka topics (order-events), services publish/subscribe. Pub/Sub: EventBridge rules route events to targets (Lambda, SQS). Benefits: decouple services, scale independently, async. Challenges: eventual consistency (order may not show immediately), debug event flows. Use for: microservices, audit trails, real-time dashboards, reactive systems. Kafka: producer.send('events', event), consumer processes.
common_patterns: Event subscription: Kafka consumer.subscribe(['user-events']), process on receive
Event Sourcing: store events (Deposited, Withdrawn), replay to get balance
CQRS: Command (CreateOrder) writes to write DB, Query (GetOrders) reads from read DB
Event Bus: AWS EventBridge, rules route events to Lambda/SQS/SNS
Pub/Sub: PUBLISH events channel, SUBSCRIBE events channel (Redis)
Saga choreography: services react to events (OrderCreated -> PaymentService -> PaymentProcessed)
Eventual consistency: data syncs asynchronously, not instant
Event replay: rebuild state from event log for debugging/recovery
Dead letter queue: failed event processing -> DLQ for analysis
